articles.description: LAGOS, Nigeria (AP) — A bomb exploded during prayers at a mosque in Nigeria’s northeastern city of Maiduguri on Wednesday night, killing five people in what police described as a likely suicide attack. Police said that 35 people were also injured in the attack. Nahum Daso, spokesperson for police co

articles.title: Scientists found a way to restore brain blood flow in dementia
articles.description: A new study suggests that dementia may be driven in part by faulty blood flow in the brain. Researchers found that losing a key lipid causes blood vessels to become overactive, disrupting circulation and starving brain tissue. When the missing molecule was restored, normal blood flow returned. This

articles.title: Trump-backed candidate wins in knife-edge Honduran election
articles.description: His rival Salvador Nasralla says he will not accept the result, but urges his supporters to remain calm.

articles.title: New technology eliminates “forever chemicals” with record-breaking speed and efficiency
articles.description: A new eco-friendly technology can capture and destroy PFAS, the dangerous “forever chemicals” found worldwide in water. articles.title: B.C. non-profit warns of gift card fraud during the holidays
articles.description: A warning for anyone getting or giving a gift card this holiday season: scammers may have already stolen the balance.

articles.title: Lethbridge charities reach Christmas Hope fundraising goal
articles.description: The Christmas Hope campaign is a collaborative effort between several charities in Lethbridge and many member organizations say they reached their fundraising goals this year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Oversees Test of New Anti-Air Missile, KCNA Says
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the testing of a new type of high-altitude, long-range missile and inspected work being done to build a nuclear-powered submarine, state media reported, ratcheting up tensions after a US nuclear submarine arrived at the South Korean port of Busan.

articles.title: Edmonton father dies in hospital E.R. waiting to see a doctor
articles.description: On Monday, Dec. 22, Prashant Sreekumar, 44, had severe chest pains while at work. A client drove him to the Grey Nuns Hospital where he died waiting to see a doctor.

articles.description: A local non-profit stepped up this week, giving out food hampers in the Downtown Eastside, Strathcona, and Chinatown, just in time for Christmas.

articles.title: Canadian Food Inspection Agency recalls vegan bacon product over undeclared wheat
articles.description: OTTAWA — The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has issued a recall for a vegan bacon product sold in Ontario because it contains wheat, which doesn’t appear on the list of ingredients.
